cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi E of Varadero, Cuba and 145 mi SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later today, then move north-northwest across the Florida Keys early Sunday, up the southwest coast of Florida Sunday afternoon, and inland over western/central Georgia by Tuesday

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC; Storm Surge Watch: Volusia/Brevard County line, FL northward to Isle of Palms, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Fernandina Beach, FL southward around Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River (does NOT include Savannah)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from the Florida Keys through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) increasingly likely late Monday; a 3% chance of hurricane-force (64 kt) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft inundation possible along the Georgia coast, including the Port of Savannah, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous surf/rip currents, and possible isolated tornadoes as the system moves inland.
